prepared_by.training_support_or_lesson_plan_or_opord: Bull Troop Squad Live Fire CONOP

values: Range OIC walks each Safety, and SL through range prior to execution.
SBF/ ASSLT each have dedicated safety.
Shift/Lift fires have visual means in PACE and clearly defined TRPs/sector stakes.
Beaten zone free of hard objects/hazards.
Targets marked with IR at night.
Safety with each maneuvering element.
Maneuver box limits marked.
M240s fire only on tripod.
TEWT and Range Safety Rehearsal
CO, 1SGT, OIC, RSO, PL, PSG, SL, and all safeties
Strict control of muzzle awareness and weapons status.
vehicles will be in park with parking brake engaged prior to personnel dismounting.
Crawl walk, run training using dry, blank and live fires.
All Soldiers will be trained and briefed on the proper way to mount and dismount a Stryker
CO, PL, PSG, SL, and all safeties
Soldiers wear Full Dragoon Standard during execution.
Leaders continuously monitor Soldiers during execution to ensure proper shooting fundamentals.
Soldiers have been taught proper handling of weapons systems.
Soldiers will not handle or fire weapons systems with which they are untrained.
Ammo Point will fully separate all types of ammunition, spent, live, and different DODIC
When switching between iterations, Leadership will personally confirm correct ammunition type for that segment of the range.
There will be no mixing of ammunition types when issued to training Soldiers.
Safety Brief, CONOP, Training Plan, PCC/PCI. Lane safeties check all ammo prior to execution
CO, OIC, RSO, PL, PSG, SL, and all safeties
Range Safeties will remove all Soldiers committing unsafe acts.
RSO will be briefed by the Commander on the proper actions of Soldiers being trained. Additionally, the Commander will empower the RSO to remove any Soldier being unsafe, regardless of rank.
CO, RSO/OIC

subtasks.hazard: Improper Use of Weapons Systems and Lasers

values: All Soldiers will be trained and qualified prior to range.
All weapons will remain oriented in a safe direction.
Lasers will only be used while actively engaging targets.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC/NCOIC, Team Leaders, Soldiers
Inform Soldiers of the types of training devices. -No one will toss any devices that may cause harm to Soldiers.
All Soldiers will be trained on the proper use of demo training devices.
RSO, CO, PL, PSG
Soldiers briefed on signs of cold weather injuries. -Uniforms will be complete, serviceable clean and dry.
Change clothing as mission allows.
All leaders will ensure proper wear of uniform giving weather conditions. 1SGT will issue packing list given weather conditions.
CO, 1SGT, PL, PSG

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, falls & other misc. injuries

values: Soldiers will execute qualification in Full Dragoon Standard.
Soldiers climbing on top of tactical vehicles will wear a helmet and maintain 3-points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
OIC/RSO understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
A designated vehicle will be marked properly for CASEVAC/MEDEVAC at the range tower.
Driver and Medic/CLS certified person will be briefed on routes, and strip maps with coordinates of AXP stored in vehicle.
Medic will carry medic certification paperwork at all times.
Driver and Medic will remain with MEDEVAC vehicle at all times.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Rehearsals
OIC/NCOIC, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Leaders will adhere to GTA UXO procedures IAW with Range SOP.
Notify the Range Control Firing Desk upon discovery or creation. Mark grid location and halt training if it poses a direct threat to Soldiers.
Safety Briefing
OIC, RSO, Safeties, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Tactical Vehicle maneuvering IVO of Dismounts

values: Soldiers will adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA.
Vehicle movement will be limited to defined maneuver lanes on Range 118.
All Soldiers inside of a tactical vehicle will either be seated in a designated seating platform or standing with a restraint harness.
No crews will be outside of vehicles while firing or maneuvering.
Leaders understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
Tactical Vehicles will use a ground guide when maneuvering within 10 meters of dismounts.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, RSO, Safeties, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous road conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, slippery roads, etc)

values: Vehicles adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA according to GTA SOP.
Vehicles will reduce speeds IOT allow safe operation of vehicle through terrain.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC. RSO, NCOs, VCs, Drivers
Movements on low risk terrain only; seat belts and harnesses will be mandatory; brief speed limits. Utilize Snow chains where necessary.
Leaders brief safety measures, then inspect compliance.
RSO, CO, PL, PSG

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Separate blank/live DODICs by placement on separate pads
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after every iteration to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified. AR/DA PAM 385-63/64 , Applicable FM/TM, or Accompanying Instructions
Ammunition NCO and Ammo Detail
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and during training period IAW WE SOP.
All issued sensitive items tied down IAW SOP.
Sensitive items inventory conducted IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.
Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, SOPs, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Soldiers
Range will cease fire if wildlife is on the range or if a fire erupts on the training range and will not go wet until all wildlife/fire has been cleared from range.
Any Soldier that spots wildlife or a fire will call the range to cease fire.
In the case of fire, range control will be called when prompted by the range meister to keep them aware of the situation.
Fire fighting detail will remain ready with all PPE in the case that they must be deployed to put out fire.
Safety/Range Brief
All Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Loss of Communication with Range Control

values: If communication with Range Control is lost, Range will immediately cease fire until communication can be returned with Range Control.
DSN, Cell Phone, FM, and Staff Duty will be used to regain communication with Range Control.
CONOP, Safety/Range Brief
OIC, RSO, NCOIC, Leaders

draw.overall_supervision_plan: Ensure proper uniform for all Soldiers during training through PCCs and Leader PCIs. Brief thorough orientation of Range 118 during the TEWT. Ensure proper shake downs between blank and live iterations. This is a living document. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level. If risk exceeds the Commander's authority, the Troop Commander (CPT Johnson) will provide risk mitigation courses of actions (COAs) to higher headquarters IOT obtain risk acceptance approval.
